Package org.nodex.java.core

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CompletionHandler<T>
    A handler that will be called when a Future completes or fails.
    Deferred<T>
    Represents something that hasn't happened yet, but will occur when the Deferred.execute() method is called.
    Future<T>
    Represents an operation that may or may not have completed yet.
    Handler<E>
    A generic handler
    Immutable
    This is a marker interface which, if implement by a class, allows instances of that class to be stored in SharedData structures.
    Nodex
    An instance of Nodex is available to all event loops in a running application.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BlockingAction<T>
    Sometimes it is necessary to perform operations in node.x which are inherently blocking, e.g.
    ConnectionPool<T>
    A simple, non-blocking pool implementation
    DeferredAction<T>
    DeferredAction is useful when you want to create your own Deferred actions.
    NodexMain  
    SimpleAction
    An Implementation of Deferred which can be used to implement custom synchronous actions.
    SimpleFuture<T>  
    SimpleHandler
    This class can be used for simple handlers which don't receive any value.
    SynchronousAction<T>
    A subclass of DeferredAction which can be used to implement custom synchronous actions.
